topic.title: HP Helion 1.2 Development Platform: Building and Deploying Windows DEA and SQL Server Express Images

ph.i: Windows, .NET, SQL Server, and IIS are either registered trademarks or trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the United States and/or other countries.

body.p: This document demonstrates how to create and deploy a Windows image in an HP Helion OpenStack environment to be used in Helion Development Platform. Image creation is needed to enable Windows support. This process can take several hours (approximately 7 hours, depending on hardware and network) and in most cases can be left unattended once the scripts begin execution.

section.title: Host Prerequisites
section.p: The following requirements pertain to the system where the Windows image will be created.

ul.li: MacOS X or Linux (Ubuntu recommended) non-virtualized environment. (i.e. the image cannot be created in a virtual machine).
Connectivity to the Internet and the Helion OpenStack environment where the Windows image will be deployed

A Windows Server 2012R2 ISO image (Volume-licensed images can be obtained through MSDN for development or test; volume-licensed production images must be obtained through the OEM channel).
The ISO must be a retail or volume licensed (non-evaluation) image
The ISO must be an English-language version.
The tool verifies that the name of the ISO image contains the following:
en
2012
x64
File extension .iso
Virtual Box version 4.3.26 or later: Download
The latest stable Virtio driver: Download
Download and extract the Glazier tool: Download. For more information about Glazier, see the Glazier Reference Guide.
A Windows product key for Windows Server 2012R2. A multiple activation key is strongly recommended, as temporary instances will be created that need product keys.
The RC file for the target Helion OpenStack environment. This can be downloaded from the Horizon interface, under Project->Compute->Access & Security->API Access->Download OpenStack RC File.

li.p: The certificate for the target Helion OpenStack environment. To retrieve this certificate, do the following:

ol.li: Find the IP address for controller0:OVERCLOUD_CONTROLLER=$(ssh root@192.0.2.1 -C ' export TE_DATAFILE=~/tripleo/ce_env.json; source ~/tripleo/tripleo-incubator/undercloudrc; nova list |grep controller0 |cut -d= -f2 |cut -d" " -f1')

Copy the CA Certificate locally:scp -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no $OVERCLOUD_CONTROLLER:/usr/local/share/ca-certificates/ephemeralca-cacert.crt /root/ephemeralca-cacert.crt.
The path to the certificate must be set in the OS_CACERT environment variable.

p.note: A Windows DEA and a SQL Server cannot both exist on the same image. You will need to create an image for each one.

section.title: Step 1: Create a Glazier Virtual Machine
section.p: This VM is used to create the images for the guest OS.

ol.li: Open Terminal and change to the Glazier directory where you extracted the tool.

Run the create-glazier command (To verify your parameters before starting the tool, you can use the --dry-run command line switch.)./create-glazier \ --windows-iso <path to Windows Server 2012R2 iso> \ --virtio-iso <path to VirtIO iso> \ --product-key <Windows Product Key> \ --os-network-id <os network ID; found in Horizon on the Network Detail page under Project -> Network -> Networks -> (select network name) > \ --os-key-name <os key pair name> --os-security-group <os security group; e.g Default> \ --os-flavor <os flavor name: e.g. m1.small> \
When the tool finishes, you will see a command prompt open in a Virtual Box instance.

section.title: Step 2: Create and Initialize the OS Windows DEA Image

ol.li: In the Glazier VM command prompt that opens after the end of the previous step, run the following command:New-Image -name "windows2012r2-windea" -GlazierProfilePath "windea"
Once the image gets created, the image will be initialized automatically.

section.title: Step 3: Create and Initialize the OS SQL Server Express 2012 Image (Optional)

ol.li: In the Glazier VM command prompt, run the following command:New-Image -name "windows 2012r2-sql2012" -GlazierProfilePath "mssql2012"
Once the image gets created, the image will be initialized automatically.

section.title: Step 4: Create and Initialize the OS SQL Server Express 2014 Image (Optional)

ol.li: In the Glazier VM command prompt, run the following command:New-Image -name "windows 2012r2-sql2014" -GlazierProfilePath "mssql2014"
Once the image gets created, the image will be initialized automatically.

section.title: Enabling Windows and SQL Server in your ALS cluster
section.p: Note that you can do this through the Horizon console instead of the command line if you prefer.

ol.li:
Create a yml file to add (e.g. manifest.yml)version: 1.2 constructor-image-name: {?} seed-node-image-name: {Windows DEA Image Name} cluster-title: MyCluster cluster-prefix: MyCluster az: {az name} constructor-flavor: standard.medium flavor: standard.medium keypair-name: {key name} stack: win2012r2 max-cluster-wait-duration: 30m network-name: {network name}
The cluster-title and cluster-prefix need to match the cluster you are deploying the image to.
Run this commandcf-mgmt add-role dea --load <file name>.yml

Create a yml file to add (e.g. manifest.yml)version: 1.2 constructor-image-name: {?} seed-node-image-name: {SQL Image Image Name} cluster-title: MyCluster cluster-prefix: MyCluster az: {az name} constructor-flavor: standard.medium flavor: standard.medium keypair-name: {key name} stack: mssql2012 max-cluster-wait-duration: 30m network-name: {network name}
The cluster-title and cluster-prefix need to match the cluster you are deploying the image to.
Run this command for SQL Server 2012cf-mgmt add-service mssql2012 --load <file name>.yml

Create a yml file to add (e.g. manifest.yml)version: 1.2 constructor-image-name: {?} seed-node-image-name: {SQL Image Image Name} cluster-title: MyCluster cluster-prefix: MyCluster az: {az name} constructor-flavor: standard.medium flavor: standard.medium keypair-name: {key name} stack: mssql2012 max-cluster-wait-duration: 30m network-name: {network name}
The cluster-title and cluster-prefix need to match the cluster you are deploying the image to
Run this command for SQL Server 2014cf-mgmt add-service mssql2014 --load <file name>.yml

section.title: Activating Windows Images
section.p: When a Windows DEA or SQL Server image node added to an ALS server, these instances need to be activated to be compliant with Microsoft licensing. You can activate by either connecting to them with Remote Desktop and activating Windows manually, or by using KVM.

section.title: Setting the Windows Administrator Password
section.p: When the new image is created, the administrator password must be set. Follow these steps to set the administrator password for the image:

ol.li: Log into the Horizon console
Select Project
Select Compute
Select Instances
Select the desired instance for which to set the password
Select Console
Select Click here to show only console
Click on the screen, and then click Send CtrlAltDel
Select Administrator
Set the new password
Log out of the console
